intro: Thespesia garckeana var. garckeana, commonly known as the Hawaiian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows in coastal areas, characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers. The plant has dark green, waxy leaves and produces orange or red flowers that bloom throughout the year. It plays an important role in the local ecosystem, providing nectar for native pollinators. Thespesia garckeana var. garckeana is also valued for its ornamental qualities and cultural significance in Hawaiian traditions.
